description.narrative: The primary project objective is to increase and improve the supply of electricity to business enterprises and households in southern Kazakhstan in an environmentally sustainable manner.

title.narrative: Reduction in CO2 emissions (in mln.metric tons)

comment.narrative: Baseline scenario estimates emission of 1.20 m tons of CO2 with no project.
Estimated 1.2 m tons of CO2 emissions avoided.

Target is expected to be achieved upon completion of a full year operation of the Moinak HPP. Moinak Hydroelectric Power Plant inQ4 of 2012 and Q1 of 2013 generated 0.42 TWh electricity, which equates to annual generation of about 0.84 TWh and about 1.0 mlntons of CO2 emission reductions.

title.narrative: Transmission lines constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Transmission lines constructed under the project
Additional installed peak capacity in the southern region of Kazakhstan

comment.narrative: Moinak HPP is commissioned with two 150MW units.
Target achieved. Both units are fully commissioned, Unit 1 was commissioned in January 2012, Unit 2 in May 2012.

title.narrative: Partial reduction of power deficit in the southern region of Kazakhstan

comment.narrative: Winter power deficit reduced by 250 MW.

Target achieved. Winter power deficit reduced by 300 MW. The value has been adjusted to reflect increase of the peak demand andreduction of thermal generation throughout the project implementation period.

title.narrative: Transmission lines rehabilitated under the project
Turn key contracts for transmission lines and substations awarded in accordance with procurement plan

comment.narrative: Target achieved. All contracts have been concluded and fully implemented.

title.narrative: Reduction in load shedding in the Almaty power region during peak demand periods

comment.narrative: Target achieved. No load shedding in Almaty region in 2012.
Target achieved. The Procurement and Project Management consultant is fully engaged.
